definition: to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
to gather together/to collect/to approach/to draw near to/to add/to sum up/to comb (hair)

sentences.english: Lobbyists use slush fund to bribe public officials.
sentences.chinese: 院外集團的說客用賄金拉攏政府官員。

sentences.english: Aware of Tian Yi Bang's unwavering loyalty, she tries to win him over.
sentences.chinese: 她知道田一邦重情重義，設法拉攏他。

sentences.english: Yellow bureau of substation of public security of this city Jiang An district is their pitch on object of the first hook in.
sentences.chinese: 他們選中該市江安區公安分局黃局爲第一個拉攏對象。

sentences.english: Whether he will also be able to claim to know those of the good burghers of celebrity-studded Neuilly is another matter.
sentences.chinese: 然而，馬提龍能否拉攏紐利市的知名人士還是一個謎。

sentences.english: There are few signs yet that cleaning up corporate America is an issue that animates the voters.
sentences.chinese: 沒有任何跡象表明，整頓美國大企業會拉攏選民。

sentences.english: Han billion intended to sign a day, Ding day promised to arrest.

sentences.english: But he was too fat and lazy To bestir himself and woo her.
sentences.chinese: 但他太胖懶來振作自己，拉攏她。

sentences.english: Second, be close with those he loves in order to fragment his awesomeness.
sentences.chinese: 二是拉攏敵君的近臣，以削弱敵國的力量。

sentences.english: Mr. Yakovlev started wooing Mr. Browne over drinks and dinner.
sentences.chinese: 雅克夫列夫開始在推杯問盞之間拉攏布朗。

sentences.english: They want to be wooed back.
Xu Dianting is going to marry Xu Lingmei to a light, so as to draw him.
sentences.chinese: 許殿亭打算把許凌梅嫁給向一光，以此拉攏他。

sentences.english: Two people at the same time draw Jenny help, Jenny in a quandary.
sentences.chinese: 二人同時拉攏珍妮幫忙，令珍妮左右爲難。

definition: to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to form an alliance/to ally oneself with/allied with/aligned/to bond with

internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
